timeline.bodyText: Aren't we potentially introducing all kinds of races here when we run this concurrently and update a bunch of maps in parallel? It seems that the logic in this method doesn't really expect this to happen and it could actually have functional impact with all the various checks we do on those maps in the computations below?
timeline.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: Yes, but that's the only "simple" way I found to ensure that DiskThresholdMonitor effectively runs the reroute after the disk space has been updated... At this point I think we should just re execute refreshDiskUsage in the assertBusy() loop until we have what we want (as initially done in #62358 (comment)).
